DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate efficacy safety Botulinum Toxin Type A versus placebo ( normal saline ) headache prophylaxis adolescent ( child 12 17 ) chronic migraine .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Using Botulinum Toxin Type A Headache Prophylaxis Adolescents With Chronic Migraine
DOC.criteria: Medical history chronic migraine least 6 month 15 headache day 4 week period Previous use botulinum toxin serotype reason Diagnosis Myasthenia gravis , EatonLambert Syndrome , Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Treatment headache use acupuncture , transcutaneous electrical stimulation ( TENS ) , cranial traction , dental splint , injection anesthetics/steroids within 4 week prior week 4 screen visit Use headache prophylaxis medication within 4 week prior week 4 screening visit
